isdevsite.title: Is Development Site?
isdevsite.description: Whether it's a development site for cs-project or not... (TODO: add more info here)

phpmailer_method.title: Method to Send Emails
phpmailer_method.description: How email is delivered; 'SMTP' means it will connect to a specified server; all others are handled by the webserver.

phpmailer_host.title: SMTP Server
phpmailer_host.description: This should be the IP of your mailserver, like 127.0.0.1 (only needed if "SMTP" is selected above)

max_time.title: Maximum Session Length
max_time.description: This is how long any single session can be open before it's automatically removed from the server.

max_idle.title: Maximum Idleness
max_idle.description: How long a session can be idle (no page views/activities) before it is removed.

config_session_name.title: Session Name
config_session_name.description: Name of the session: really, this only matters if you have other websites running under the same domain using PHP sessions, in which case this should be unique to avoid random annoying issues.

version_string.title: Version String
version_string.description: This is an important INTERNAL setting that should NEVER be changed manually unless you really know what you're doing.

stop_logins_on_global_alert.title: Stop Logins on Global Alert
stop_logins_on_global_alert.description: (Currently unimplemented) Stop users from logging in if a global alert has been created.

debugprintopt.title: Debug Printing?
debugprintopt.description: Generally, this should only be turned on if you're running a development site for cs-project...

debugremovehr.title: Debug Print: Add 'HR' Tag?
debugremovehr.description: This setting affects whether or not there are separators between debug_print()'s (useful to discover if there's a print occurring that is otherwise not visible)

workingonit.title: Working On It?
workingonit.description: WARNING! Setting this to a non-zero value will DISABLE all connections to the database, and make your site unuseable. It is provided as a simple, fast way to stop connections to your database, usually for maintenance purposes. It is displayed here for reference only.

database__dbname.title: Database Name (cs_project)
database__dbname.description: Name of the database within PostgreSQL (i.e. 'cs_project')

database__port.title: Server Port
database__port.description: Port to connect to PostgreSQL on (default is 5432)

database__user.title: Database Username
database__user.description: Username for connecting to PostgreSQL (if you don't know it's probably 'postgres', though connecting as a SUPERUSER is generally accepted as a BAD THING).

database__password.title: Database Password
database__password.description: Password for connecting to PostgreSQL (for a trusted connection, this can be blank)
